DataElement.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Planned Clinical Study Activity Reporting Period Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of planned schedule related to a clinical study after the reporting period for a therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells from a donor to a patient with a myeloid or lymphocytic malignancy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Planned Clinical Study Activity Reporting Period
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the interval time of a therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells from a donor to a patient with a myeloid or lymphocytic malignancy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Property.preferredName: Planned Clinical Study Activity Reporting Period
Property.preferredDefinition: Any activity specified in a clinical study protocol that is anticipated to be performed during the execution of the study.:The act of providing a short account.:An interval of time. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Any activity specified in a clinical study protocol that is anticipated to be performed during the execution of the study.
The act of providing a short account.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Planned Clinical Study Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation planned schedule for clinical study after reporting period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.

Concepts.definition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Used with organs, tissues, or cells for transplantation from one site to another within the same subject, or from one subject to another of the same species or different species.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Generally refers to relative simple learning situations in which a stimulus initially incapable of evoking a certain response acquires the ability to do so by repeated pairing with another stimulus that does elicit the response.: A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant.

Concepts.definition: Generally refers to relative simple learning situations in which a stimulus initially incapable of evoking a certain response acquires the ability to do so by repeated pairing with another stimulus that does elicit the response.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.: Earlier in time or order.: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.: Observation; watching something and taking note of what happens.: An interval of time. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
